issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify Animal.messageOnFeed() as returning a String, but the solution repository implements messageOnFeed() to return a FeedResponse object (and provides a FeedResponse class). This is a cross-artifact method return type mismatch: students reading the problem/UML will implement messageOnFeed() to return String, while the reference solution uses a different return type, which will cause confusion about the expected signature and the type to use when printing feed messages.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type of messageOnFeed() consistent across artifacts. Either: (A) Change the solution to match the problem/UML by having Animal.messageOnFeed() return String and update Seal, Pig, Goat to return the required String messages (and remove or stop using FeedResponse), or (B) If FeedResponse is intentional, update the problem statement and UML to specify that messageOnFeed() returns a FeedResponse and document the FeedResponse type and its intended usage. Option A is recommended to preserve the current exercise description.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) specifies that Animal.messageOnFeed() returns a String (messageOnFeed():String) and the song/printing examples expect direct string values from that method. The solution implementation changes this conceptual return type to a FeedResponse object (Animal.messageOnFeed(): FeedResponse) and adds a new FeedResponse class. This introduces a new identifier (FeedResponse) for the same conceptual entity (the feed message), which is not mentioned in the problem statement or template. Students following the problem/template will implement messageOnFeed() to return a String, but the reference solution uses FeedResponse — creating a direct mapping and compilation/expectation mismatch and unnecessary cognitive load.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the representation of the feed message across artifacts. Option A (preferred for clarity/simple mapping): revert the solution to match the problem/template by making messageOnFeed() return a String (remove or stop using FeedResponse) and update Seal/Pig/Goat to return the required String messages (e.g. "Arf Arf!", "Oink!", "Maah!"). Option B: if FeedResponse is intentionally desired, update the problem statement and template to specify that messageOnFeed() returns a FeedResponse (document the FeedResponse fields and how to obtain the message, e.g., getMessage()/toString()) so students can map requirements to the provided type.
